metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The following example will demonstrate a poll where the result is shown without reloading.
content.html: The following example will demonstrate a poll where the result is shown without reloading.

content.text: Do you like PHP and AJAX so far?
When a user chooses an option above, a function called "getVote()" is executed. The function is triggered by the "onclick" event:
content.html: When a user chooses an option above, a function called "getVote()" is executed. The function is triggered by the "onclick" event:

content.code:
Do you like PHP and AJAX so far?

Yes:
No:
content.code_html:
<html>
<head>
<script>
function getVote(int) {
  var xmlhttp=new XMLHttpRequest();
  xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function() {
    if (this.readyState==4 && this.status==200) {
      document.getElementById("poll").innerHTML=this.responseText;
    }
  }
  xmlhttp.open("GET","poll_vote.php?vote="+int,true);
  xmlhttp.send();
}
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div id="poll">
<h3>Do you like PHP and AJAX so far?</h3>
<form>
Yes: <input type="radio" name="vote" value="0" onclick="getVote(this.value)"><br>
No: <input type="radio" name="vote" value="1" onclick="getVote(this.value)">
</form>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: The getVote() function does the following:
The page on the server called by the JavaScript above is a PHP file called "poll_vote.php":
content.html: The page on the server called by the JavaScript above is a PHP file called "poll_vote.php":

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<?php
$vote = $_REQUEST['vote'];

//get content of textfile
$filename = "poll_result.txt";
$content = file($filename);

//put content in array
$array = explode("||", $content[0]);
$yes = $array[0];
$no = $array[1];

if ($vote == 0) {
  $yes = $yes + 1;
 }
if ($vote == 1) {
  $no = $no + 1;
 }

//insert votes to txt file
$insertvote = $yes."||".$no;
$fp = fopen($filename,"w");
fputs($fp,$insertvote);
fclose($fp);
?>

content.code:
Result:

Yes: %
No: %

content.code_html:
<?php
$vote = $_REQUEST['vote'];

//get content of textfile
 $filename = "poll_result.txt";
$content = file($filename);

//put content in array
 $array = explode("||", $content[0]);
$yes = $array[0];
$no = $array[1];

if ($vote == 0) {
  $yes = $yes + 1;
}
if ($vote == 1) {
  $no = $no + 1;
}

//insert votes to txt file
 $insertvote = $yes."||".$no;
$fp = fopen($filename,"w");
fputs($fp,$insertvote);
fclose($fp);
?>

<h2>Result:</h2>
<table>
<tr>
<td>Yes:</td>
<td><img src="poll.gif"
width='<?php echo(100*round($yes/($no+$yes),2)); ?>'
height='20'>
<?php echo(100*round($yes/($no+$yes),2)); ?>%
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>No:</td>
<td><img src="poll.gif"
width='<?php echo(100*round($no/($no+$yes),2)); ?>'
height='20'>
<?php echo(100*round($no/($no+$yes),2)); ?>%
</td>
</tr>
</table>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<?php
$vote = $_REQUEST['vote'];

//get content of textfile
$filename = "poll_result.txt";
$content = file($filename);

//put content in array
$array = explode("||", $content[0]);
$yes = $array[0];
$no = $array[1];

if ($vote == 0) {
  $yes = $yes + 1;
 }
if ($vote == 1) {
  $no = $no + 1;
 }

//insert votes to txt file
$insertvote = $yes."||".$no;
$fp = fopen($filename,"w");
fputs($fp,$insertvote);
fclose($fp);
?>

content.text: The value is sent from the JavaScript, and the following happens:
content.html: The value is sent from the JavaScript, and the following happens:

content.text: The text file (poll_result.txt) is where we store the data from the poll.
content.html: The text file (poll_result.txt) is where we store the data from the poll.

content.text: The first number represents the "Yes" votes, the second number represents the "No" votes.
content.html: The first number represents the "Yes" votes, the second number represents the "No" votes.

content.text: Note: Remember to allow your web server to edit the text file. Do NOT give everyone access, just the web server (PHP).
content.html: Note: Remember to allow your web server to edit the text file. Do NOT give everyone access, just the web server (PHP).
